sub_topic: Finding the phase shift of trigonometric functions
message_1: A student needs to find the phase shift of y = 2sin(3x - π/4). What is the phase shift of this trigonometric function?
message_2:
The phase shift of a trigonometric function is the horizontal shift of the function along the x-axis. For the given function y = 2sin(3x - π/4), the phase shift can be found by setting the argument of the sine function equal to zero:

3x - π/4 = 0

Now, solve for x:

3x = π/4
x = (π/4) / 3
x = π/12

The phase shift of the function y = 2sin(3x - π/4) is π/12.
